GET.name: GET /
GET.description: This route serves the React page currently displays the card viewer page which uses almost all of the endpoints

GET.name: GET api/docs
GET.description: This returns the JSON data that renders this page

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards
GET.description: This is a dynamic endpoint that accepts query parameters to filter cards by any of their properties, Accepts JSON, XML, or CSV headers

statusCodes.description: On success
On receiving invalid or no query parameters
If no cards match the query parameters

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/fields
GET.description: Returns a list of all card properties

statusCodes.description: On success
If the valid field names array is empty

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/filters
GET.description: Returns a list of valid card properties to filter cards by

statusCodes.description: On success
If the valid fiter names array is empty

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/all
GET.description: Returns all of the cards in the database. Accepts JSON, XML, and CSV headers.

statusCodes.description: On success
If the cards database is empty

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/random
GET.description: Returns a random card in the database. Accepts JSON, XML, or CSV headers.

statusCodes.description: On success
If no card is found somehow

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/recent
GET.description: Returns the last card in the database. Accepts JSON, XML, or CSV headers.

statusCodes.description: On success
If no card is found somehow

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/:guid([0-9a-zA-Z-]{36})
GET.description: Accepts a card guid and returns the card. Accepts JSON, XML, or CSV headers.

statusCodes.description: On success
If no card is found with the given guid

GET.name: GET or HEAD /api/cards/:fieldName/:value
GET.description: Accepts a filter field name and a value and returns all cards that match the filter. Accepts JSON, XML, or CSV headers.

statusCodes.description: On success
If no card is found with the given fieldname and value
If the field name is not a valid field name

POST.name: POST /api/cards
POST.description: This endpoint accepts a full card object as a json body and adds it to the database

statusCodes.description: On success
If the body object is empty or does not contain any valid properties
If the database insert operation fails

PUT.name: PUT /api/cards/:guid([0-9a-zA-Z-]{36})
PUT.description: Takes a card guid and a json object as a body. The body object only contains the updated properties

statusCodes.description: On success
If no card is found with the given guid
If the body object is empty or does not contain any valid properties
If the database update operation fails
On success
If no card is found with the given guid
If the database delete operation fails

GET.name: GET /api/assets/card-images
GET.description: Returns a list of the file names of the card images

statusCodes.description: On success
If there is was an error reading the card image directory

GET.name: GET /api/assets/:asset
GET.description: A dynamic endpoint that accepts an asset name and returns the asset as a file

statusCodes.description: On success
If there was an error reading the image directory or sending the file
If the asset was not found

GET.name: GET /api/assets/cards/:asset
GET.description: A dynamic endpoint that accepts an asset name, specifically a card webp image, and returns the asset as a file

statusCodes.description: On success
If there was an error reading the image directory or sending the file
If the asset was not found

GET.name: GET /api/effects/all
GET.description: Returns a list of all effects in the database

statusCodes.description: On success
If the effects database is empty

GET.name: GET /api/effects/:id
GET.description: Returns the effect with the given id

statusCodes.description: On success
If the effect wasn't found

Links.name: No 404 page, all non /api routes redirect to /

FrontendCalls.name: GET /api/cards/all
FrontendCalls.description: The default endpoint call of the card viewer, renders the cards using the JSON data.

FrontendCalls.name: GET /api/cards/?
FrontendCalls.description: This is the endpoint called when using the filter or search menu. It supports multiple filters, partial name match, and OR logc when selecting multiple filters of the same type

FrontendCalls.name: GET /api/effects/all
FrontendCalls.description: Grabs the list of pre defined effects to add/remove from the cards.

FrontendCalls.name: GET /api/assets/card-images
FrontendCalls.description: Gets the list of card image file names to populate the dropdown in the editor.

FrontendCalls.name: GET /api/assets/:asset
FrontendCalls.description: Gets the file name from the card data and uses it to call the asset endpoint to return the card image.

FrontendCalls.name: PUT /api/cards/:guid
FrontendCalls.description: Called when clicking the save button in the card editor, sends the updated card data to the server. Only sends the updated fields.

FrontendCalls.name: POST /api/cards
FrontendCalls.description: Called when clicking the save button after pressing the New Card button in the card viewer.

FrontendCalls.name: DELETE /api/cards/:guid
FrontendCalls.description: Called when clicking the delete button in the card editor.
